Class IniFile

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--IniFile
public class IniFile
extends java.lang.Object

Reads/Writes options of a .ini file The class remembers alignment used by the user, and tries to keep it that way if it writes to the file again. Basic line structure: [ variable = value ] [ # comment ]

getBoolean

boolean getBoolean(java.lang.String param)
Reads a option/parameter, and converts it into boolean.
Everything that begins with a letter contained in the variable True is true. Everything else if false.
So you can use i.e "yes", "no", "true" and "false",
but if you like you can also use "yep", "never", "nope", "yobaby", "forget it", "totaly", ...
Parameters:
param - The option key. (Left side of '=')
param - DefaultValue that is returned, if parameter is missing or incorrect
Returns:
The option value.

getBoolean

boolean getBoolean(java.lang.String param,
                   boolean defaultValue)

flush

public void flush()
Writes the current representation of the file back to disk. Should look exactly the same as it was before, except the changes by setParameter.

NeedsFlush

boolean NeedsFlush()
